comments.commentBody: Greenberg is lucky to purchase a good team at a bargain price(chapter 7). I am glad he gave the due credits to Ryan, Daniels, and Washington. I still believe Lee prefers to be a Yankees than a Ranger for 4 reasons: (1) Yankees have a better chance to reach the playoff series every year than Rangers do. (2) Lee had told reporters that he does not like to pitch in hot weathers. (3) Lee has told his buddy Sabathia that he loves to pitch in the Yankees stadium. (4) Yankees probably will offer more money.

It would be nice if the announcers knew the rules of baseball. Buck just said "ties go to the runner." From Little League on up, the rulebook says the runner must beat the ball to be safe. Tie does not go to the runner.
I find it somewhat amusing that a rookie and someone rescued from the bargain bin by the Giants has provided more clutch hitting than A-Rod, Tex, and most of the Yankees multi-million dollar line-up.
Really enjoyable puzzle by Dan, and a greet write-up by Rich.  Many thanks.

Mr. Spitzer is one of the few fighting the good fight against the fraud perpetrated on the American public by the big banks.  We need someone like that with a public forum.  I am not excusing Mr. Spitzer's behaviour.  However, what the banks did is also immoral and unethical; the difference is Mr. Spitzer's behavior affected a small group of people (his family, associates etc), while the behavior of the financial sector affected EVERYONE in America.  You want to talk about rewarded for vice?  How about the biggest bonuses ever for crashing the economy?

Hmm... I am guessing that nobody will figure this one out, as Mr. Jobs does like to surprise! Facebook has too many security issues & does not seem very 'Apple-like' to me, plus Zuckerberg has no intentions to sell. I am leaning towards a unique technology related to WiFi -- LTE technology for 4G...?

The Province of Saskatchewan could just buy the darn thing itself. A bond issue to finance this would sell very well. Maybe I come out of retirement and stop traveling for a couple of months to work on this. After all, it was the province that started the company.

C. ALEXANDER BROWN

All of the bozos who announced the death of this company are looking like idiots. I bought their junk debt at 15 cents on dollars, have gotten ~ 15 cents in interest and bonds are trading ~ 70.
See you at par baby...

Thanks for the entertaining blogging gentlemen. So many to choose from but the reference to Dirty Harry and comment about calling Romo "Tony" and "Enrique" are my favorites. Victorino as sparrow in the storm gets honorable mention.

Keep having fun!

@Peter, yes, that goes without saying that Div 1 hockey is a higher level than even top Prep school hockey; however, the story and study are about the higher levels of concussions experienced by the women than by men. I played high school hockey at that same school where I reffed female hockey, and the boys were far less likely to carry the puck with their heads down.

While you assume that once these players get to the D1 level they don't carry the puck head down, I can assure you that even at the NHL level, you sometimes see the most incredible hits, where the player carrying the puck does not see the hit coming, whether they either have their head down or they are looking the other way. Look at the last Winter Olympics where there were lots of instances where the women were skating with their heads down. Okay, not all of them are D1 caliber, but more women skated with their heads down than in the Men's bracket. The point is that the comparison is relative to the other sex. At each level you look at, I would wager that the women do indeed take more unprepared hits, and more often are skating with their heads down.

Sorry for getting sidetracked, but my original point was not just that women were more likely to skate with their heads down, but that they were also far more likely to be unprepared for contact in the corners, while looking down at the puck and digging it out. Men expect to be hit in the corners. I just wonder if the women are not expecting it as much and thus are more susceptible to getting concussed.

But Rooney is right... MU has not been keeping pace with the rest of the top tier teams in terms of bringing in and retaining talent. They let go Tevez who was a fantastic complement to Rooney. They let Ronaldo go and replaced him with a hodgepodge of decent, but far inferior, talent with the likes of Obertan and Valencia. And so far this seasons the Red Devils seem hardly the imposing force of 2 seasons ago when they seemed virtually unstoppable. So Rooney is right to complain. But he is quite the fool the way he is coming off publicly. I agree with other posters that this certainly doesn't bode well for him, especially after he had an awful national team campaign and end/start of the EPL season. Quite frankly, I'm not sure where he can go where he's guaranteed a similar paycheck and ample playing time on the pitch. Real Madrid don't need him. Barca isn't a good system for him and they also aren't in dire straits for a striker. The Milans are both stacked and not in need of another finisher. Perhaps Man City would like to blow another $100m during the January transfer window??

As for MU, my sympathies don't run very deep. They poached him from Everton in the first place and they've more than gotten their value from him. In fact, now would be the time to offload him for maximum value. They always seem to land on their feet.
So if time isn't important, why did you bother to check (and still know) yours?  And still recall your Dad's?

If you think you are quite an athelete, try the 'Ironman" in Kona, Hawaii.
They stick the full marathon on the end of a 2.4 mile swim and a 106 mile bike race. All in succession in one day.
Try that NY marathoners!

Ever since I read of Dan's death, I have had mixed feelings when I see his name; I look forward to a wonderful puzzling experience but regret using up another limited resource.  Now the time has come to praise Dan's puzzles and remember all of them with fondness.  Rich helped assuage our sense of loss.

The real story is that another woman named McEwen has now gone public with her account of Justice Thomas' behavior that absolutely verifies Anita Hill's testimony. Thomas' conservative activist wife's last-dirch effort to save her conservative husband is sad, but predictable. Thomas needs to resign, now.
My first thought when I heard about this is that Virginia Thomas wants her husband to run for President in 2012, backed by the Tea Party, and was trying to take an old issue off the table.

What a weird and nasty telephone call to make to Anita Hill! What is this woman that is married to Justice Thomas really about? Justice Thomas' wife is a real drawback to him, as if he needed any more, considering he sits on the court like a "bump on a log", hardly ever saying anything, as he doesn't seem capable of saying anything.

What an embarassment this woman and her husband, Justice Thomas, are to the court. He is there for life, for heavens sake.

I recommend that everyone e-mail Mrs. Thomas at Liberty Central (easy enough to Google their web site) and express your displeasure at this gambit of hers. Remind her of all the points people have made here - that Anita Hill passed a lie detector test, for example, proving that she was answering honestly the questions put to her. Ask her why she felt the need to leave such a clearly passive aggressive message? Ask her who extends an olive branch by accusing someone of a crime? Ask her why her husband continues to serve on the Supreme Court while she engages in such overt political activity that clearly creates for him a conflict of interest?

Maybe we can overload Liberty Central's server and put the silly right wingnut organization out of business - at least for a while!

What Mrs. Thomas fails to clarify in her phone message to Ms. Hill is just what the latter needs to apologize for. For lying? I doubt it: as a previous commenter wrote, Ms. Hill passed a polygraph test, whilst Mr. Thomas declined the offer to take one.

I suspect Anita's guilt, in Mrs. Thomas' mind, was in her making "too big a deal" of what happened.
Mrs. Thomas' behavior is creepy and troubling, just like Justice Thomas.
Let's call them what they are: The 2002 George W. Bush tax hikes - he signed them into law.
This should work great in Alaska, favored newest child of the New South: This is a congressional election year, but don't forget which party has made a black man your president.

Ms. Thomas was harassing Ms. Hill, plain and simple. This was no olive branch. More like a willow switch meant to cause pain. Ms. Hill, continue to do as you were doing: leading a life of intellectual accomplishment and quiet dignity. You are an example of unstinting courage for so many women and we will always applaud you.

If it wasn't for people like Mrs. Thomas making hilarious public blunders like this one, what on earth would we have to laugh about?

Mr. and Mrs. Thomas clearly deserve each other.

I'm with #4. That's the most passive-aggressive message I've heard in a while. The Thomas hearings were long ago, and I don't care about them anymore, but that phone message is hilarious!

I think that Virginia Thomas has a screw loose, and I would love it if she prayed a bit and figured out why she did what she did. OK, have a nice day!
